    • Method Detail

      • disposeImpl

        protected void disposeImpl()
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Implementation specific disposal. Implementations should always invoke super.disposeImpl().

        The default implementation marks TileReader.valid as false.

        This method will always be externally synchronized on this.readLock.

        Overrides:
        disposeImpl in class TileReader

      • isMultiResolution

        public final boolean isMultiResolution()
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the source is multi-resolution. If true the source can decode the image at resolutions other than the native resolution without subsampling. If false all tiles at a resolution other than the native resolution must be subsampled.

        Use of a TileCache does not make a TileReader multi-resolution.

        Overrides:
        isMultiResolution in class TileReader
        Returns:
        true if the source contains tiles at multiple resolutions, false otherwise.

      • read

        public final TileReader.ReadResult read​(int level,
                                        long tileColumn,
                                        long tileRow,
                                        byte[] data)
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Reads the specified tile at the specified level and stores the data in the specified array. The returned data will have dimensions consistent with TileReader.getTileWidth(int, long) and TileReader.getTileHeight(int, long) for the specified level, tile column and tile row.
        Overrides:
        read in class TileReader
        Parameters:
        level - The resolution level
        tileColumn - The tile column
        tileRow - The tile row
        data - Output buffer for the data of the specified tile
        Returns:
        true if the read completed successfuly, false if the operation was canceled asynchronously

      • read

        public final TileReader.ReadResult read​(long srcX,
                                        long srcY,
                                        long srcW,
                                        long srcH,
                                        int dstW,
                                        int dstH,
                                        byte[] data)
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Reads an arbitrary region of the image at an arbitrary scale. The source data will be scaled to meet dstW and dstH.
        Specified by:
        read in class TileReader
        Parameters:
        srcX - The source (unscaled) x-coordinate of the region
        srcY - The source (unscaled) y-coordinate of the region
        srcW - The source (unscaled) width of the region
        srcH - The source (unscaled) height of the region
        dstW - The output width
        dstH - The output size
        data - Output buffer for the data of the specified tile
        Returns:
        true if the read completed successfuly, false if the operation was canceled asynchronously
        See Also:
        TileReader.read(int, long, long, byte[])
